title: Leonardo Ulloa: Leicester striker ‘betrayed’ by Claudio Ranieri and claims he will never play for champions again
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LEONARDO ULLOA claims he will “never play for Leicester again” after seeing a move to Sunderland fall through. 
David Moyes is keen on signing the Argentine forward but saw a £7million bid rejected this afternoon. PA:Press Association Leonardo Ulloa insists he will go on strike at Leicester after a move to Sunderland collapsed With all respect for LCFC FANS.I feel betrayed by Ranieri and let down by the club. I will not play again for them… 
— Jose Leonardo Ulloa (@Ciclone1923) January 30, 2017 
Ulloa is also desperate to make the deal happen after slapping in a transfer request last weekend. Keep up to date with ALL the Leicester news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
And he insists he will now go on strike after being “betrayed” by boss Claudio Ranieri, who ruled out an exit before Tuesday’s deadline earlier today. 
Ulloa took to Twitter to deliver his extraordinary rant, saying: “With all respect to LCFC fans… I feel betrayed by Ranieri and let down by the club. I will not play again for them.” PA:Press Association Black Cats boss David Moyes is desperate to bring Ulloa to the Stadium of Light Stoke 2-2 Leicester : Vardy sent off but Ulloa strike begins Foxes comeback Reuters 5 Claudio Ranieri insists Ulloa will not be sold before Tuesday's deadline 
Ulloa is furious that he's been denied a move to the Stadium of Light, with a tweet over the weekend hinting that a deal was close. 
It read: "Thanks to all the fans at LCFC. Two wonderful years but I need to feel like a footballer again." 
But the Foxes have turned down the Black Cats’ latest offer with boss Claudio Ranieri insisting Ulloa will stay with the Premier League champions. 
He said: “I know he is very, very anxious but we don’t change our mind. For us it’s important. We don’t want to sell him. 
“Also I don’t want to because I have just Islam Slimani as a targetman and I need another targetman. “I want Leo here and I hope he can be calm and understand my position. Of course he’s not happy and I understand him. The club know my position very well and also Leo knows very well. 
“Leo is a fantastic player and a fantastic man and I believe in him.” 
Ulloa has started just twice for Ranieri’s side this season and Leicester have also rejected bids from Spanish side Alaves. Darren Bent scores a comical own goal for Derby against Leicester in the FA Cup
